item.title: Introducing Brockman
item.description: Claiming that us programmers focus most of our programming time on using encapsulation and automation to reduce complexity is like chefs claiming most of their job focuses on preparing food, and that heat and recipes are essential tools. Pretty obvious. Yet, while we relentlessly pursue encapsulation and automation when enforcing information-hiding in classes or continuously deploying our applications, our personal workstations can be the wild west. Essential tasks like system updates, anti-virus scans, and file garbage collection should be automated.
